channel.title: 2006 International CES Audio Center
channel.description: Information and News about the 2006 International CES
channel.itunes:author: CEA
channel.itunes:subtitle: Sponsored by Yahoo!

item.title: Mobile Music - Business Models - Downloads, Subscriptions and Ringtunes
item.description: Mobile and music are the two most complementary sectors to emerge out of the integration of the entertainment and technology industries.
item.itunes:author: Scott R. Campbell

item.title: Maximizing Your Wireless Retail Marketing Results
item.description: To increase their sales, agents spend millions of their co-op dollars each year on advertising, but have no way of tracking and measuring the results.
item.itunes:author: Ed Legum

item.title: The Telco Advantage and the IPTV Digital Home
item.description: This is the year that the Telcos make their entry into the Digital Home, providing the full array of services, starting with the basic telecommunications packages, moving along into VoIP, Wireless, Broadband and finally into the full set-up video assortment of otherwise broadcast and cable based entertainment, news, movie and sports offerings.
item.itunes:author: Richard Doherty

item.title: VC Investment in the Entertainment and Technology Space
item.description: The VC and Investment community has always led the way in recognizing the newest opportunities in the technology and entertainment space.
item.itunes:author: Joey Tamer

item.title: Music Industry Innovates into the Future
item.description: This is the year of the continued rollout of new music services as well as the arrival of broadband, mobile and wireless.
item.itunes:author: Ted Cohen

item.title: Next Generation P2P Music and Film
item.description: While the debate over legal issues in music and movie distribution of content continues, the P2P and distributed computing industry is making strides in taking its technologies into the mainstream.
item.itunes:author: Marty Lafferty

item.title: Competition for Pay TV - Wall Street Report
item.description: Satellite, cable, telco, IP video - who wins, who loses? Is there enough to go around for everyone? A panel of Wall Street analysts presents their viewpoints.
item.itunes:author: Jimmy Schaeffler

item.title: IP Video - Challenges and Opportunities
item.description: Major telecom operators have announced plans to deliver advanced video services including HDTV over DSL.
item.itunes:author: Vince Vittore

item.title: Digital Imaging: How the Digital Shift Has Changed Consumer Usage Patterns for Photographs
item.description: The ways in which to capture, store and share digital photos are growing rapidly.
item.itunes:author: Joni Blecher

item.title: The Digital Family of the Future
item.description: We already know a great deal about the current digital camera owner. However, the future of digital photos is no longer clearly in the realm of the single purpose digital camera.
item.itunes:author: Tim Herbert

item.title: Market Opportunities for Personal Robotics
item.description: Personal robots are those goods which are bought by individual consumers for the purpose of education, entertainment, cleaning, home security, or as technical hobbyist.
item.itunes:author: Shawn Wood

item.title: Impact of China on the Industry
item.description: Licensing issues. Innovation. Lower prices, sometimes lower quality. All part of the increasing impact that China is having on our CE industry.
item.itunes:author: Evan Ramstead

item.title: Service Delivery in the Future
item.description: With satellite, telcos and cable providers offering voice, data and video, consumers have the option to receive all their content and services from one company.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg

item.title: Industry Vision vs. Consumer Desire
item.description: What's turning consumers off? What's keeping them from buying new products?
item.itunes:author: Edward C. Baig

item.title: Playing On Broadway 2009, Bye Bye Analog Television
item.description: Discussion delves into the analog cutoff

item.title: Distributing Entertainment to the Whole Home and Beyond
item.description: Session discusses multiple networks and the ways content is being distributed

item.description: Discusses challenges facing portable media players...

item.description: Explores the business opportunity for the in-vehicle entertainment...

item.description: The TV industry like the movies has forged a perfect relationship...
